page.title: 13CARDROSS _ NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: {HABITATS -}TIDAL MUDFLATS, FERTILE FARMLAND, VILLAGE GARDENS, WOODS AND MOORLAND PROVIDE FOR A VARIETY OF PLANTS, MAMMALS AND BIRDS. THE AREA LIES BETWEEN THE BIRD-RICH PENINSULA OF ARDMORE AND LOCH LOMOND. {BIRDS -}MORE THAN 150 SPECIES HAVE BEEN RECORDED. THESE INCLUDE OYSTER- CATCHERS, CURLEWS, GREENSHANKS, WILLOW AND GARDEN WARBLERS, SPOTTED FLY_ CATCHERS, FIELDFARES, REDWINGS, WOOD_ PECKERS, BUZZARDS, OWLS AND SPARROW- HAWKS AS WELL AS MIGRATING GEESE. {ANIMALS -}THE RABBIT, HARE ROE DEER, FOX, WEASEL, GREY SQUIRREL, AS WELL AS ESCAPED MINK AND BAT ARE FOUND. FROGS, TOADS, NEWTS, AND ADDERS ABOUND. {BUTTERFLIES -}ELEVEN SPECIES ARE RECORDED REGULARLY AS WELL AS SOME MOTHS.
